mainEntity.name: What if I move in the middle of the month? Is the first month's rent prorated at Sun Chase Apartments in Las Vegas?

acceptedAnswer.text: To move in, you must pay a full month's rent. Your next rent payment will be prorated—a smaller amount. For example, let's say you move in on the 15th of June; there are 16 days left in the month. Before you move in, you pay the full rent, say, $800. Then next month, on July 1st, your rent is only 16 days worth of rent: $427. We just want the bigger amount of rent first. In the end, you only ever pay rent for the days you were actually here.
